result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy D. Harder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged complete 9 hours community service per week.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed. 

No violent or abusive contact with victim.

Assessment, treatment, counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE program intake, assessment and completion. 

AODA and follow up. 

DNA sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: I/S to be used for rules violations.
I/S to be used for rules violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy D. Harder

records.addlTxt: and reimbursement to county- sent to accountant
Re: Order for Payment and Reimbursement to County
Probation review hearing on December 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing Documents

Clerk Amy. 
Case called at 11:01 a.m. 
State appears by ADA Natalie Zibolski; Defendant appears in person with Attorney Sharon Gisselman. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed; VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

PLEA to Count 1 (Disorderly Conduct/Repeater/Domestic Abuse)>>GUILTY.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation.

CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  SAFE program intake, assessment and completion.  Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.  Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances unless valid prescription and taken only as prescribed.  AODA and follow up.  No violent or abusive contact with victim.  60/90/120 day probation review hearings.  120 days MCJ I/S to be used for rules violations.  40 hours community service I/S to be used for rules violations.  Court costs including DNA sample/surcharge including Domestic Abuse surcharge. 

Probation review hearing>>12/16/22 at 1:15 p.m. 

Adj:  11:20 a.m.
Victim impact statement- S.N.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 7, 2022 at 01:20 pm.

Defendant appears in person with Atty Sharon Gisselman. 

Date and time set for FPT; VRCW.

Defendant makes statement.

COURT continues current dates set on case.

records.addlTxt: Atty Sharon Gisselman

No contact with S.L.N., Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No contact with L.H. unless supervised by S.L.N. and in a public place. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
Order Appointing Counsel

Called: 3:57 p.m. 
Clerk: Amy. 
State appears by ADA Lacey Coonen for ADA Natalie Zibolski. 
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 

Date and time set for review hearing. 
COURT questions deft on how he wants to proceed. 
Defendant states he spoke with former attorney but cannot take his case; still requests to move forward with indigency hearing. 
Defendant sworn and testifies. 
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 
Court appoints Attorney Sharon Gisselman @ $100/hr. not to exceed $1000.00 without further order of the Court. 

ADA Coonen addresses letter from victim re: no contact be lifted with L.H. with supervision.  
Defendant makes statement. Victim makes statement. 
ADA Coonen makes objections re: changes to no contact with L.H. 
COURT makes findings and grants bond modification relative to L.H. to include no contact unless supervised by S.L.N. and in a public place.  

Next hearing>>FPT 8/11/22 at 3:00 p.m. 

Adj:  4:05 p.m.

NO APPEARANCES. 

Court dismisses request for Indigency Request.

Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:04 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence.   Defendant appears in custody by video from MCJ with Atty Adam Fontana. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA:  Not guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with S.L.N., L.H. unless supervised by adult 25 years or older. 
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 2 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
